description: Apparently from English tiffing, present participle of tiff (“to take a small drink, to sip”) (slang).

entries.meaning: (Britain, India) A (light) midday meal or snack; luncheon.
(Britain, India) A box or container used to carry a tiffin.
A cake-like confection composed of crushed biscuits, sugar, syrup, raisins, cherries and cocoa powder, often covered with a layer of melted chocolate.

verbs.description: tiffin (third-person singular simple present tiffins, present participle tiffining, simple past and past participle tiffined)

entries.meaning: (Britain, India, intransitive) To eat a (light) midday meal or snack.
